chapter.title: Architecture
chapter.para: The Diameter architecture consists of the following core components:

listitem.para: Stack
Multiplexer (MUX)
Message Validator and Dictionary

section.title: Stack
section.para: The Diameter Stack is the primary component of the Diameter solution. The Stack governs the mechanisms that control message sending and receiving, peer management, and session management. The stack manages these resources using State Machines.

section.title: Configuring the Stack
section.para: The stack is configured using an XML file that contains the options set during initialization. The top level structure of the file is described below. Further explanation of each child element, and the applicable attributes is provided later in this section.
section.programlisting: <LocalPeer> <URI value="aaa://127.0.0.1:1812"/> <IPAddresses> <IPAddress value="127.0.0.1"/> </IPAddresses> <Realm value="mobicents.org"/> <VendorID value="193"/> <ProductName value="jDiameter"/> <FirmwareRevision value="1"/> <OverloadMonitor> <Entry index="1" lowThreshold="0.5" highThreshold="0.6"> <ApplicationID> <VendorId value="193"/> <AuthApplId value="0"/> <AcctApplId value="19302"/> </ApplicationID> </Entry> </OverloadMonitor> </LocalPeer>
section.para: The <LocalPeer> element contains parameters that affect the local Diameter peer. The available elements and attributes are listed for reference.

listitem.para: Specifies the URI for the local peer.
Contains one or more child <IPAddress> elements that contain a single, valid IP address for the local peer.
Specifies the realm of the local peer, using the value attribute.
Specifies a numeric identifier that corresponds to the vendor ID allocated by IANA.
Specifies the name of the local peer product name.
Specifies the version of the firmware.
Optional parent element containing child elements that specify settings relating to the Overload Monitor.
Specifies three attributes that control the overload element index, overload low threshold and overload high threshold.
Parent element containing child elements that specify information about the application
The Authentication Application ID.
The Account Application ID

section.para: The <Parameters> element contains elements that specify parameters for the Diameter stack. The available elements and attributes are listed for reference.

listitem.para: Specifies whether the stack will accept connections from unidentified peers. The defalut value is false.
Specifies whether duplicate message protection is enabled. The defalut value is false.
Specifies the time each duplicate message is valid for. The default, minimum value is 240000 (4 minutes in milliseconds)
Specifies whether the Ericcson SDK Emulator. The defalut value is true.

section.para: The <Network> element contains elements that specify parameters for external peers. The available elements and attributes are listed for reference.

listitem.para: Parent element containing child elements that specify external peers and the way they connect.
Specifies the name of the external peer, whether the peer should be treated as a server or client, and what rating the peer has externally.
Parent element containing child elements that specify all realms that connect into the Diameter network.
Child element containing attributes and elements that describe the different realms configured for the Core.
